website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, dependable boot perfect for short or long hikes over all types of terrain.
pros: Firm and sturdy construction means that these boots don't lose their shape over time
cons: Some complain the boots run a little large

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Investment
customer_reviews.text: First test: the Koko Head Stairs on Oahu, 500 steps built with railroad ties in to the side of a steep, dormant volcano. All around me those who wore running shoes, particularly the low-profile "barefoot" style, slipped on the dusty surface and fell on their behinds. But my feet never budged. Each step was as firm and secure as anyone would want. Second test: the black, jagged lava field inside Kilauea Iki Crater on Hawaii Island, reminiscent of an asphalt parking that giants have attacked with jackhammers. Four hours later, my feet were the most comfortable of any in our group. Would definitely recommend these shoes, particularly if they last the 20 years that another reviewer mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Moya

customer_reviews.title: Runs Very small, narrow toe, but beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great boot, my last pair of Vasque sundowners I bought 25 years ago, but they don’t fit anymore. Passing them along to my sister. The leather on these is suede or “open grain” leather, which is ok, just not what I was expecting. I wear a 8&1/2 or 9, and wanted a 9&1/2 wide but they were out of stock. Tried a 9 wide. I had them shipped to my workplace, when they were too small, a co-worker LOVED them and bought them from me! Now I’m going to buy 10 wide, which is a ridiculously large size for me normally, but it seems that is what I need in this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Totally disappointed in the quality of these new boots. They’re nothing like the old pair I was trying to replace. These are not the same. Don’t buy them if you’re expecting the same quality you bought in the 1990s! So bad I didn’t keep them - I was so disappointed and have been waiting for years to see them go on sale while I had a budget for them. I’m taking my old boots to a cobbler instead.
customer_reviews.author: S. R.

customer_reviews.title: tongue attachment at top rubs the front of the ankle.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his Sundowners, so I bought a pair for backpacking. I wore them a few times before going backpacking, and the side of the boot where the tongue attaches at the top rubbed the front of my ankle. I loosened the ties and they were okay, so I went backpacking in them. With the extra weight of the backpack, the tongue area again rubbed my ankles almost raw. I wish I could return them, but they are scuffed after the backpacking trip. I am ordering a Vasque Breeze instead.
customer_reviews.author: Natalee Weir

customer_reviews.title: Best Boot on the Market
customer_reviews.text: These are my all-time favorite hiking boots. I had to buy a new pair to replace my original pair, which I had for 20 years and only needed to get rid of because I left them outside in the elements for too long. They are stiff and take some time to break in, but it’s well worth it. They will end up being the most comfortable, supportive boot you’ll ever wear. I’ll never buy anything else as long as Vasque makes this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite hiking boots. I have purchased 5 pair since 2008 and will not look at any other brand. No need to break them in.. You can wear them year around. They are truly waterproof. I hope Vasque never stops making the Sundowner.
customer_reviews.author: B. Petereson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product / Backpacking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for work and backpacking. Originally I ordered a size 10, but I ended up needing a size 10.5. I think this is due to how my foot and toes are shaped (I have long toes!). The toe box was a little snug with the first pair, whereas with the larger pair it was great. These boots are high-quality, look great, and are incredibly comfortable. I appreciate that they do not have a lot of weight to them, which will be great for both hiking and backpacking endeavors. If you're looking for an affordable pair of all-leather, waterproof hiking boots, these are it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love them, but they got a little tight when ...
customer_reviews.text: I STILL have my Sundowners from 20 years ago when they were made in Italy. I love them, but they got a little tight when I replaced the soles so I had to hand them down to my daughter. The new ones have so much cushion and support, it almost makes it tough to wear other shoes. I've had the boots for a couple months now, wear them as much as possible--to work, on city walks, on hikes, building up for a big backpacking trip this month. So far I'm still getting blisters after about 4 miles, but had the same problem with the original pair until they were fully broken in.
customer_reviews.author: KKay

customer_reviews.title: A bit harder to break in that I would have liked, but solid boots
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these on and off for about 4-5 months. They're definitely solid, sturdy, and quite waterproof. They were a bit harder to break in than some other leather boots I've had in the last 15 years or so, but I'm hoping that also means they'll last a bit longer than the 2 years or so I've gotten out of each of my last few pairs from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Realon

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but I have to order up a size
customer_reviews.text: Great boots but I had to return them because they were too small. I will order up a size. UPDATE: I ordered up a size and also a wider size and the fit is fantastic. I normally wear a 9b and I ordered a 10 extra wide and they fit perfectly. I LOVE these boots. They are my second pair.
customer_reviews.author: JMB Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Is this normal?
customer_reviews.text: Leather looks worn out of the box, I don't know if that's normal. Ordered 1/2 size up and it's too small still, so I went ahead and ordered full size up. New pair looks better and fits better too! Undecided if I will keep, but it's definitely the most sturdy hiking boot I've put on. Going to try a few others.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: These are the best boots on the planet
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots on the planet! I used them in 1993 to 1999, hiking all over Alaska and the western US. Had them even resoled, I loved them so much and the uppers are super strong. Had used different styles of hiking boots over the last few years and finally found these again this past winter. Breaking them in now .....
customer_reviews.author: PJx2

customer_reviews.title: Still a great boot!
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous pair for more than 10 years and was disappointed when they were discontinued only to rejoice that they have come back into production. My last pair of Sundowner's (10.5 women's, normally wear a 9.5 shoe) lasted forever and were great on all types of terrain. The glue on the sole started giving way the same time the tread was wearing out. This pair has a very similar fit and construction!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bruise easy and had bruises around my ankles the first day ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a mushroom forager, which takes me off the beaten trail. I bought these for the woods. 1.) They are GORGEOUS 2.) Fit is very stiff when you first put them on. I bruise easy and had bruises around my ankles the first day 3.) My feet felt very hot at first. 4.) #2 and #3 both resolved themselves after I broke them in. 5.) I will buy these boots again when my last pair bites it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but you must break them in.  Don't put them on and decide they are uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair, and I have been very satisfied. I mainly want a winter boot that has good traction. What I like about this boot is it's leather and looks good to wear to work. They don't look like casual hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Kwapich

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy boot on bottom but not as beefy around the ...
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy boot on bottom but not as beefy around the top as I expected. Not high on the ankle, if you are looking for that type of boot.The tongue seems a bit filmsy, not sure it is leather? The boot is very comfy. I hope it holds up on the mountain trails. Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: happy to travel

customer_reviews.title: I have been waiting for Vasque to "remake" these boots ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for Vasque to "remake" these boots because my first pair have finally fallen apart after nearly 24 years of use. I am hoping these new ones last as long, if they do they will outlast me. I will be pushing up daisies long after they give out if they are of similar construction as the originals. So far I have only put on around 10 miles on side walks and they are still very stiff and hopefully they will break in soon. The fit seems appropriate for my foot size.
customer_reviews.author: SRBadGriff

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these boots for years but they changed the model enough that my normal size was way too small so I went up a half size and they were still too tight and narrow. My feet felt like they had a vice clamp on them. I’m returning them and may try the wide version but I wish vasque had stuck to the original design. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Matt Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for wide sizes too
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots, so very comfortable. I wear a wide and it fit like a glove. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wagnon

customer_reviews.title: Throwback to The Originals
customer_reviews.text: I have owned in the past when they were made in Italy I have tried on more recent models and then dissatisfied IA was impressed by the reviews and thought I would give this a shot they fit like my old ones dead I am very happy
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Best boot ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boot I have ever had. It’s the boot National Park Rangers wear and all love. I have worn my for years. Keep them waterproofed and conditioned. You can step in water 5 1/4 in deep before getting your sock wet.
customer_reviews.author: linda wight

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!! Beautifully made, I don't think they're going to need much breaking in, they fit beautifully, just enough room for double socks, very comfortable. Can't wait to try them out on a hike.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: I normally wear 8. 5 or 9's in woman's ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear 8.5 or 9's in woman's boots and I needed a 9.5 in these. Boots are stiff but not uncomfortable. Sole is really thick and NOT flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots! I bought my first pair 28 years again! I had bought them for my trip to Nepal. They last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dearden

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made, fits well,have toe wiggle room. Will take a while to break in before hiking. Wore a pair of vasque boots for 8+years, loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rock star hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Rock star hiking boot. My second pair. First pair I got in 1992 and the sole fell off in 2006. So happy to find another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lynn Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ankle support and traction
customer_reviews.text: Invest the time to break these in well ahead of your intended use. Wear thin nylon sock under a hiking sock to prevent blisters. Excellent ankle support and traction. Size was perfectly calibrated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I was replacing a pair I had for probably 30 years. The fit and feel is as expected, wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I <3 Vasque
customer_reviews.text: I ended up exchanging for a 1/2 size larger than I normally wear. If you are looking for a rigid hiker for stability on incline hikes, I highly recommend, however, if you are looking for just a basic day-hiker, these will be too much boot for you.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I usually wear a 7 but ordered a 7 1/2 after reading the reviews. They are a little big but that's ok with me. I will just wear thicker socks! A well made boot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Teresa Rolen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them, But I get to get 1 size up
customer_reviews.author: ilio

customer_reviews.title: These fit better then the skywalk for me
customer_reviews.text: These fit better then the skywalk for me, but they were still way too narrow, I had to return them. There was no way I could have worn them, my toes were tingly from just sitting there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Great color. Soft leather. Thick comfy soles. Lots of tread. Comes with red and brown laces.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A truly special re-issue of the Italian boots.
customer_reviews.text: This retro reissue is a truly special boot. Don't confuse it with the standard Sundowner. This model is made like the original Italian boot and made with USA tanned leather. Just issued in the fall of 2015.
customer_reviews.author: E. Woods

product_meta.title: Vasque Women's Sundowner Gore-Tex Backpacking Boot
product_meta.description: At Vasque, they are committed to making functional, innovative and aesthetic footwear that performs to the highest standards. Their ultimate goal is to make shoes that inspire you to get outdoors and embark on an adventure. Incorporating and developing new and innovative technologies into their boots is what keeps Vasque at the top of their game.
feature_bullets: Mid-cut leather hiker with minimal overlays and stitching
Cambered heel for effective hiking stride
